description: Unitary-sociable numbers (smallest member of each cycle).
comments: If n=product p_i^a_i, d=product p_i^c_i is a unitary divisor of n if each c_i is 0 or a_i.
references: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, 3rd edition, Sect. B7
links: Herman Jamke (hermanjamke(AT)fastmail.fm), Nov 01 2006, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..44
David Moews, Perfect, amicable and sociable numbers
J. O. M. Pedersen, Tables of Aliquot Cycles
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Sociable Numbers
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: More terms from Herman Jamke (hermanjamke(AT)fastmail.fm), Nov 01 2006
